block.minecraft.banner.description: A highly customizable free-standing decoration. Can be crafted using dyes in various patterns.
item.minecraft.shield.description: Allows the player to block, reducing damage taken from attacks.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page1.line1: Press %s to learn more about Horses, Donkeys, Mules, and Llamas.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know about Horses, Donkeys, Mules, and Llamas.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page2.line1: Horses, Donkeys, and Llamas are found mainly in open plains and savannas. Mules can be bred from a Donkey and a Horse, but are infertile themselves.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page3.line1: All adult Horses, Donkeys, Mules, and Llamas can be ridden. However only Horses can be armored, and only Mules, Donkeys, and Llamas can be equipped with saddlebags for transporting items.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page4.line1: Horses, Donkeys, Mules, and Llamas must be tamed before they can be used. A horse is tamed by attempting to ride it, and managing to stay on the horse while it attempts to throw the rider off.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page5.line1: When tamed, Love Hearts will appear around them and they will no longer buck the player off.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page6.line1: Try to ride this horse now. Use %s with no items or tools in your hand to mount it. To dismount the horse, press %s.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page7.line1: To steer a horse, they must be equipped with a saddle. Saddles can be bought from villagers or found inside chests hidden in the world.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page8.line1: Tame Donkeys, Mules and Llamas can be given saddlebags by attaching a chest. These bags can be accessed whilst riding or when sneaking.
tutorial.lceui.horse.page9.line1: Horses, Donkeys, and Llamas (but not Mules) can be bred like other animals by using Golden Apples or Golden Carrots. Foals will grow into adults over time, although feeding them wheat or hay will speed this up.
tutorial.lceui.bed.title: This is a bed. Press %s while pointing at it at night to sleep through the night and awake in the morning.
tutorial.lceui.bed.page1.line1: Press %s to learn more about beds.
tutorial.lceui.bed.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know about beds.
tutorial.lceui.bed.page2.line1: A bed should be placed in a safe, well-lit place so that monsters do not wake you in the middle of the night. Once you have used a bed, if you die you will respawn at that bed.
tutorial.lceui.bed.page3.line1: If there are other players in your game, everyone must be in a bed at the same time to be able to sleep.
tutorial.lceui.creative_inventory.title: This is the creative mode inventory. It shows items available for use in your hand, and all the other items that you can choose from.
Press %s if you already know how to use the creative mode inventory.
Use %s to move the pointer.When on the item list, use %s to pick up an item under the pointer, and use %s to pick up a full stack of that item.
The pointer will automatically move over a space in the use row. You can place it down using %s. Once you have placed the item, the pointer will return to the item list where you can select another item.
If you move the pointer outside the edge on the interface with an item on the pointer, you can drop the item into the world. To clear all items in the quick select bar, press %s.
Scroll through the Group Type tabs at the top using %s and %s to select the group type of the item you wish to pick up.
If you want more information about an item, move the pointer over the item and press %s.
tutorial.lceui.inventory.title: This is your inventory. It shows the items that are available for use in your hand, and all of the other items that you are carrying. Your armor is also shown here.
tutorial.lceui.inventory.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know how to use the inventory.
tutorial.lceui.inventory.page2.line1: Use %s to move the pointer. Use %s to pick up the item that is under the pointer. If there is more than one item here this will pick them all up, or you can use %s to pick up just half of them.
tutorial.lceui.inventory.page3.line1: You can place items down again by using %s. With multiple items on the pointer, use %s to place them all or %s to place just one.
tutorial.lceui.inventory.page4.line1: If you move the pointer outside the edge of the interface with an item on the pointer, you can drop the item.
tutorial.lceui.inventory.page5.line1: If you want more information about an item, move the pointer over the item and press %s.
tutorial.lceui.brewing.title: This is the brewing interface. You can use this to create potions that have a variety of different effects.
tutorial.lceui.brewing.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know how to use the brewing stand.
tutorial.lceui.brewing.page2.line1: You brew potions by placing an ingredient in the top slot, some Blaze Powder in the fuel slot, and a potion or water bottle in the bottom slots (up to 3 can be brewed at one time). Once a valid combination is entered the brewing process will start and create the potion after a short time.
tutorial.lceui.brewing.page3.line1: All potions start with a Water Bottle. Most potions are created by first using a Nether Wart to make an Awkward Potion, and will require at least one more ingredient to make the final potion.
tutorial.lceui.brewing.page4.line1: Each Blaze Powder will power the Brewing Stand for long enough to distill up to 20 ingredients. Blaze Powder can be crafted from Blaze Rods, which are dropped by the Blazes found near Nether Fortresses.
_comment: The above string contains a Blaze Powder icon.
tutorial.lceui.brewing.page5.line1: Once you have a potion you can modify its effects. Adding Redstone Dust increases the duration of its effect, and adding Glowstone Dust can make its effect more powerful.
tutorial.lceui.brewing.page6.line1: Adding Fermented Spider Eye corrupts the potion and can turn it into a potion with the opposite effect, and adding Gunpowder turns the potion into a Splash Potion which can be thrown to apply its affect to a nearby area.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.title: This is the Anvil interface, which you can use to rename, repair and apply enchantments to weapons, armor, or tools, at the cost of Experience Levels.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page1.line1: Press %s to learn more about the Anvil interface.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know the Anvil interface.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page2.line1: To begin working on an item, place it in the first input slot.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page3.line1: When the correct raw material is placed in the second input slot (e.g. Iron Ingots for a damaged Iron Sword), the proposed repair appears in the output slot.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page4.line1: Alternatively, a second identical item can be placed into the second slot to combine the two items.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page5.line1: To enchant items on the Anvil, place an Enchanted Book in the second input slot.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page6.line1: The number of Experience Levels that the work will cost is shown beneath the output. If you do not have enough Experience Levels, the repair cannot be completed.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page7.line1: It is possible to rename the item by editing the name shown in the textbox.
tutorial.lceui.anvil.page8.line1: Picking up the repaired item will consume both items used by the Anvil and decrease your Experience Level by the given amount.
tutorial.lceui.firework_interface.title: This is the Firework interface, which you can use to craft Fireworks and Firework Stars.
Press %s if you already know how to use the Firework interface.
To craft a Firework, you'll need Gunpowder and Paper.
You can optionally place one or more Firework Stars into the crafting grid to add them to the Firework.
Filling more slots in the crafting grid with Gunpowder will increase the height at which all of the Firework Stars will explode.
You can then press %s to craft your completed Firework.
Firework Stars can be crafted by placing Gunpowder and Dye into the crafting grid.
The Dye will set the color of the explosion of the Firework Star.
The shape of the Firework Star can be set by adding either a Fire Charge, Gold Nugget, Feather, or Mob Head.
A trail or a twinkle can be added using Diamonds or Glowstone Dust.
tutorial.lceui.firework_interface.page10: After a Firework Star has been crafted, you can set the fade color of the Firework Star by crafting it with Dye.
tutorial.lceui.enchanting_table.title: This is the enchanting interface which you can use to add enchantments to weapons, armor, and some tools.
tutorial.lceui.enchanting_table.page1.li: Press %s to learn more about the enchanting interface.
Press %s if you already know about the enchanting interface.
tutorial.lceui.enchanting_table.page2.li: To enchant an item, first place it in the enchanting slot. Weapons, armor, and some tools can be enchanted to add special effects such as improved damage resistance or increasing the number of items produced when mining a block.
tutorial.lceui.enchanting_table.page3.li: When an item is placed in the enchanting slot, the buttons on the right will change to show a selection of random enchantments.
tutorial.lceui.enchanting_table.page4.li: The two numbers on the button represent the cost in Lapis Lazuli and experience levels to apply that enchantment to the item. If you do not have a high enough level or have not provided enough Lapis Lazuli the button will be disabled.
tutorial.lceui.enchanting_table.page5.li: Select an enchantment and press %s to enchant the item. This will decrease your experience level by the cost of the enchantment.
tutorial.lceui.enchanting_table.page6.li: Although the enchantments are all random, some of the better enchantments are only available when you have a high experience level and have lots of bookcases around the Enchantment Table to increase its power.
tutorial.lceui.beacon.title: This is the Beacon interface, which you can use to choose powers for your Beacon to grant.
tutorial.lceui.beacon.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know how to use the Beacon interface.
tutorial.lceui.beacon.page2.line1: In the Beacon menu you can select 1 primary power for your Beacon. The more tiers your pyramid has the more powers you will have to choose from.
tutorial.lceui.beacon.page3.line1: A Beacon on a pyramid with at least 4 tiers grants an additional option of either the Regeneration secondary power or a stronger primary power.
tutorial.lceui.beacon.page4.line1: To set the powers of your Beacon you must sacrifice an Emerald, Diamond, Gold Ingot, or Iron Ingot in the payment slot. Once set, the powers will emanate from the Beacon indefinitely.
tutorial.lceui.furnace.title: This is the furnace interface. A furnace allows you to change items by firing them. For example, you can turn iron ore into iron ingots in the furnace.
tutorial.lceui.furnace.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know how to use a furnace.
tutorial.lceui.furnace.page2.line1: You need to put some fuel into the bottom slot of the furnace, and the item to be changed in the top slot. The furnace will then fire up and start working, putting the result in the right-hand slot.
tutorial.lceui.furnace.page3.line1: Many wooden items can be used as fuels, but not everything burns for the same time. You may also discover other items in the world that can be used as a fuel.
tutorial.lceui.furnace.page4.line1: When your items have been fired, you can move them from the output area into your inventory. You should experiment with different ingredients to see what you can make.
tutorial.lceui.trading.title: This is the trading interface which displays trades that can be made with a villager.
tutorial.lceui.trading.page1.line1: Press %s to learn more about the trading interface.
tutorial.lceui.trading.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know the trading interface.
tutorial.lceui.trading.page2.line1: All trades that the villager is willing to make at the moment are displayed along the top.
tutorial.lceui.trading.page3.line1: Trades will appear red and be unavailable if you do not have the required items.
tutorial.lceui.trading.page4.line1: The amount and type of items you are giving to the villager are shown in the two boxes on the left.
tutorial.lceui.trading.page5.line1: You can see the total number of the items required for the trade in the two boxes on the left.
tutorial.lceui.trading.page6.line1: Press %s to trade the items the villager requires for the item on offer.
_comment: Next tutorial shows when the player has 2 depleted hunger icons (4 hunger points)
tutorial.lceui.hunger.title: Your food bar has depleted to a level where you will no longer heal.
tutorial.lceui.hunger.page1.line1: Press %s to learn more about the food bar and eating food.
tutorial.lceui.hunger.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know about the food bar and eating food.
tutorial.lceui.hunger.page2.line1: As you move around, mine, and attack, you will deplete your %2$s bar. Sprinting and sprint jumping use a lot more %2$s than walking and jumping normally.
tutorial.lceui.hunger.page3.line1: If you lose some health, but have a %2$s bar with 9 or more %2$s in it, your health will automatically replenish. Eating food will replenish your %2$s bar.
tutorial.lceui.hunger.page4.line1: With a food item in your hand, hold %s to eat it and replenish your %2$s bar. You cannot eat if your %2$s bar is full.
_comment: Next tutorial shows when you open the Crafting interface in Survival (not a Crafting Table, just the 2x2 crafting interface).
tutorial.lceui.crafting.title: This is the crafting interface. This interface allows you to combine the items you've collected to make new items.
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page1.line2: Press %s if you already know how to craft.
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page2.line1: Scroll through the Group Type tabs at the top using %s and %s to select the group type of the item you wish to craft, then use %s to select the item to craft.
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page3.line1: The crafting area shows the items you require in order to craft the new item.
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page3.line2: Press %s to craft the item and place it in your inventory.
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page4.line1: You can craft a larger selection of items using a crafting table. Crafting on a table works in the same way as basic crafting, but you have a larger crafting area allowing more combinations of ingredients.
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page5.line1: The bottom right part of the crafting interface shows your inventory. This area can also show a description of the currently selected item, and the ingredients required to craft it.
_comment: Next line shows instead of ''Press %s to continue.''
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page5.line2: Press %s to show the item description.
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page6.line1: The description of the currently selected item is now displayed. The description can give you an idea of what the item can be used for.
_comment: Next line shows instead of ''Press %s to continue.''
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page6.line2: Press %s to show the ingredients required to make the current item.
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page7.line1: The list of ingredients required to craft the selected item is now displayed.
_comment: Next line shows instead of ''Press %s to continue.''
tutorial.lceui.crafting.page7.line2: Press %s to show the inventory again.
_comment: Next string shows when an enemy is attacked without a sword. Shows once for each tool (pickaxe, axe, shovel).
tip.lceui.mining: Hint: Hold %s to mine and chop using your hand, or whatever you are holding. You may need to craft a tool to mine some blocks...
tip.lceui.wrong_attack_tool: Certain tools are better for attacking enemies. Consider using a sword to attack.
